headline: Bill: Outside Prosecutors for Police Deadly Force Cases
author: Joseph De Avila
description: Connecticut lawmakers are considering legislation that would require outside prosecutors to investigate incidents where police officers use deadly force, an effort to increase transparency.

headline: Attorney General Nominee Takes the Stage
author: Andrew Grossman and Devlin Barrett
description: Loretta Lynch will step into the Senate spotlight on Wednesday as the Justice Department she has been nominated to lead considers a series of hot-button issues ranging from possible civil-rights violations by police to government leaks.

headline: Ferguson Court Sees New Era as State Judge Takes Over
author: Ben Kesling
description: A Missouri state-appointed judge presided over the Ferguson municipal court for the first time, inaugurating changes to a system deemed biased against minorities by the U.S. Department of Justice.

headline: A Brief History of Protest Songs
author: Eric Danton
description: Protest songs have been around for centuries, particularly during times of war and social unrest. Here’s a brief survey of protest songs dating back to 17th-century England, starting in the Vietnam War era.

headline: No Slowdown on NYPD Enforcement, Union Says
author: Michael Howard Saul
description: New York City’s main police union hasn’t initiated or supported a deliberate slowdown, the union’s president said, a day after records were released showing a steep reduction in arrests and summonses for a second week in a row.

headline: Top Judge Urges Grand-Jury Changes
author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien
description: New York’s top judge on Tuesday proposed legislation to make grand-jury proceedings more open to the public and have judges preside over deliberations for police-involved homicides and serious assaults.

headline: Turning Ferguson Into a Federal Case Won’t Be Easy
author: Devlin Barrett and Ben Kesling
description: A decision by a Missouri grand jury not to indict Darren Wilson shifts the focus to the Justice Department and whether federal civil rights charges are warranted in the shooting.

headline: Holder Widens Guidelines That Limit Profiling
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Attorney General Eric Holder laid out new guidelines against racial and other types of profiling, citing law-enforcement cases that have sparked protests even as the new federal policy wouldn’t affect local police.

headline: Europe Sees Ferguson as Blight on U.S. Rights Record
author: Stephen Fidler, Gregory L. White and Bertrand Benoit
description: Europe’s reaction to the rioting in the Missouri town of Ferguson reflects a common theme on the continent: that America’s human-rights record excludes its African-American minority.

headline: N.Y. Officer Indicted in Death of Unarmed Man
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: A New York City police officer was indicted on multiple charges, including manslaughter, in the November shooting death of an unarmed black man in a housing project, a senior law-enforcement official said.

headline: St. Louis Suburbs Sued for ‘Debtors Prison’ System
author: Ben Kesling
description: Nearly a dozen residents of Ferguson, Mo., filed a lawsuit in federal court Sunday alleging the city racked by recent racial unrest violates constitutional protections by jailing people in unsanitary conditions for an inability to pay outstanding fines on misdemeanors.

headline: Protestor Leaders to Keep Pressing for Change
author: Kris Hudson
description: Organizers and participants in nationwide weekend protests of police treatment of minorities say the movement is evolving to include more lobbying for legislative and political change.

headline: An Officer Calms Ferguson’s Streets
author: Ben Kesling
description: A fourth straight night of street-blocking civil disobedience Saturday was punctuated by arrests, but was less confrontational thanks, in part, to a police commander using calmer tactics with protesters.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Set to Reconvene
author: Ben Kesling
description: Nightly protests continued here through the weekend as residents, police and demonstrators brace for a decision from a grand jury set to reconvene Monday.

headline: N.Y. Legislature to Debate Police Issues
author: Erica Orden
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo pledged to seek a broad legislative package of changes to law enforcement procedures and the grand jury process a day after a grand jury decided not to indict the police officer in Eric Garner’s case.

headline: Protesters Slosh Over New York City Venues
author: Josh Dawsey, Thomas MacMillan and Mark Morales
description: Demonstrators angry over a grand jury’s decision not to indict a policeman in the death of an unarmed African-American man, Eric Garner, converged on Friday on some of New York City’s most famous businesses and venues.

headline: Adam Pendleton: The Making of an Art-World Star
author: Ellen Gamerman
description: Virginia-born Adam Pendleton’s race-infused take on the 20th-century avant-garde, “Black Dada,” is conquering the art world one major venue at a time. London’s Pace Gallery is next.

headline: Turning Ferguson Into a Federal Case Won’t Be Easy
author: Devlin Barrett and Ben Kesling
description: A decision by a Missouri grand jury not to indict Darren Wilson shifts the focus to the Justice Department and whether federal civil rights charges are warranted in the shooting.

headline: New York’s Mayor Faces Fresh Test in Ambush Deaths
author: Michael Howard Saul and Josh Dawsey
description: The ambush killings of two New York City police officers on Saturday poses a new challenge for a mayor whose support of recent protests has drawn some criticism.

headline: Ferguson Community Makes Moves to Begin Healing Process
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Police on Monday morning reported no overnight arrests in this city as a result of ongoing protests over a police-involved fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager almost four months ago.

headline: Protest Movement Spreads
author: Jacob Gershman
description: As protests against police violence spread nationwide, President Obama and New York City’s mayor said the anger sparked by a pair of controversial grand-jury decisions underscored the need for a broader national conversation about race relations and civil rights.

headline: An Officer Calms Ferguson’s Streets
author: Ben Kesling
description: A fourth straight night of street-blocking civil disobedience Saturday was punctuated by arrests, but was less confrontational thanks, in part, to a police commander using calmer tactics with protesters.

headline: NYPD Arrests 4 After Threats to Officers
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Since the shooting deaths of two police officers Saturday afternoon, the NYPD has launched 40 investigations into possible threats

headline: Cleveland Family Calls for Charges  in Boy’s Shooting
author: Matthew Dolan
description: The mother of a 12-year-old boy who was shot dead by police while carrying a toy gun in a Cleveland park in November called on Monday for criminal charges against the officer involved.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Set to Reconvene
author: Ben Kesling
description: Nightly protests continued here through the weekend as residents, police and demonstrators brace for a decision from a grand jury set to reconvene Monday.

headline: Leaders Pledge Police Changes in Light of Garner Case
author: Andrew Tangel
description: New York political leaders vowed to pursue changes and civil-rights leaders announced a protest march in Washington, D.C., a day after a grand jury declined to indict a police officer in the death of Eric Garner.

headline: Charleston Mayor Rallies City After Fatal Shootings
author: Mara Gay And Josh Dawsey
description: The deadly shooting at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church has trained a spotlight on longtime Charleston Mayor Joseph Riley, a soft-spoken liberal Democrat who has been in office since 1975.

headline: NYC Mayor, Police Unions Postpone Debate
author: Michael Howard Saul And Pervaiz Shallwani
description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and the city’s largest police union have vowed to put aside their strife until after two officers fatally shot last weekend were laid to rest.

headline: Hundreds Mourn Man Shot by Police Officer
author: Valerie Bauerlein
description: Mourners at Walter Scott’s funeral remembered him as a loving father and friend whose fatal shooting by a white police officer should be a catalyst for national change.

headline: Tompkins Houses, Near Attack on Police, Had Felt Safer
author: Jennifer Smith
description: Crime has long been a problem near the Tompkins Houses, the Brooklyn public-housing development across the street from where two officers were killed on Saturday.

headline: How It Felt to Be a ‘Suspicious’ Black Teen
author: Gary Fields
description: Ferguson reminds a Journal reporter of times in his youth when he was singled out by police.

headline: Ferguson Grand Juror Sues Over Lifetime Gag Order
author: Ben Kesling
description: A grand juror in the case of the police-involved shooting in Ferguson, Mo., filed suit to break a gag rule protecting the secrecy of the controversial proceedings.

headline: NYPD Orchestrates Protest Moves
author: Pervaiz Shallwani  And Thomas MacMillan
description: New York City’s approach to protests in response to a grand jury decision in not to the indict a white police officer in the chokehold death of a black man is starkly different than the approach in Ferguson, Mo.

headline: ‘Between Riverside and Crazy’ Opens This Week
author: Stefanie Cohen
description: Stephen Adly Guirgis’s play, ‘Between Riverside and Crazy,’ tells the story of a white cop who shoots an older black cop, echoing recent events in Ferguson, Mo., and New York.

headline: Police Monitor Social Media for Threats
author: Ashby Jones  and Joe Palazzolo
description: Police departments have little legal recourse against people who threaten violence against their officers, but they are aggressively monitoring social media in hopes of identifying dangers and thwarting violence.

headline: ‘Between Riverside and Crazy’ Opens This Week
author: Stefanie Cohen
description: Stephen Adly Guirgis’s play, ‘Between Riverside and Crazy,’ tells the story of a white cop who shoots an older black cop, echoing recent events in Ferguson, Mo., and New York.

headline: Thousands Gather to Honor Slain NYPD Officer
author: Leslie Brody
description: Thousands of mourners gathered Friday at a Queens church to pay their respects to a slain New York City police officer, a day before his funeral was expected to draw thousands of police from across the country.

headline: Pilgrimage, Prayer for Slain Officers
author: Michael Howard Saul, Sonja Sharp and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Across the city, the festive bustle of Christmas Day was tempered by the sorrowful memory of the fatal shootings of two New York City police officers.

headline: Push for Transparency on Police Killings Gathers Pace
author: Rob Barry
description: Lawmakers clear legislation that would give states and federal law-enforcement agencies strong incentives to report deaths in custody and during arrests.

headline: Protesters Plan Response to Ferguson Decision
author: Ben Kesling
description: As both sides wait for a decision on whether a grand jury will indict the white Ferguson police officer who killed a black teenager in August, protesters stood in the falling snow Sunday, waiting to step off on a well-organized march.

headline: Grand Jury Records in Garner Case Will Stay Sealed, Judge Rules
author: Michael Howard Saul  and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: A state Supreme Court justice has rejected requests to release the minutes of the Staten Island grand jury that declined to indict the New York City police officer involved in the Eric Garner case.

headline: Gunman Acted Alone, New York City Police Say
author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien and Michael Howard Saul
description: Ismaaiyl Brinsley, the alleged killer of two police officers was apparently motivated by antigovernment and anti-police sentiment. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio asked New Yorkers to put aside politics and unify behind the families of the dead officers.

headline: Bay Area Protests Are Latest in Long Tradition
author: Alejandro Lazo and Zusha Elinson
description: Demonstrations in cities of Oakland and Berkeley reflect the region’s history of social activism and militant street action.

headline: Web Store Unloads Old Items Offline
author: Ellen Emmerentze Jervell
description: For Europe’s largest online retailer, Zalando, the end of the holiday shopping rush opens a new sales window in the real world.

headline: Social Media Help Fuel Protests Around the Country
author: Jennifer Smith and Andrew Tangel
description: Demonstrators mixed with tourists and commuters at famous sites here as they protested a grand jury’s decision not to indict a white New York City police officer in the death of a black man.

headline: Report Calls for More Police Body Cameras
author: Gary Fields and Colleen McCain Nelson
description: A presidential task force on policing calls for increased use of body cameras and other technology, and expanded efforts to connect officers with neighborhoods.

headline: Protesters Fan Out as Missouri Gov. Calls For New Security Funds
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Nearly 100 locations from utility substations to sports stadiums are under watch this weekend by the Missouri National Guard and state Highway Patrol, Gov. Jay Nixon wrote in a Saturday letter to lawmakers.

headline: Obama Seeks New Policing Standards Post-Ferguson
author: Colleen McCain Nelson and Byron Tau
description: President Barack Obama called for new standards for federal programs that equip local police departments with military gear, which had drawn criticism amid the police response to protests in Ferguson, Mo.

headline: Low-Wage Workers Protest Over Pay
author: Melanie Trottman
description: Low-wage workers from increasingly varied workplaces are staging strikes and protests in 35 states and 190 cities on Thursday, demanding higher minimum wages.

headline: Cleveland Officer’s Acquittal in Two Deaths Sets Off Protests
author: Associated Press
description: A white Cleveland officer who fired down on a car at the end of a 137-shot barrage that left the two unarmed black occupants dead was acquitted of criminal charges, setting off angry but mostly orderly protests.

headline: A Sea of Blue Salutes Fallen Police Officer
author: Michael Howard Saul
description: Thousands of police officers from around the country gathered in Queens for the funeral service of Rafael Ramos, one of the two New York City police officers killed in an ambush last weekend.

headline: Missouri Shooting Sparks Protests
author: Ben Kesling and Joe Barrett
description: The police-involved shooting death of an allegedly armed black man in a St. Louis suburb led to small protests and four arrests overnight, according to police.

headline: Michael Brown’s Parents Announce Lawsuit
author: Associated Press
description: Lawyers for the parents of an unarmed, black, 18-year-old who was fatally shot by a white police officer in the St. Louis suburb of Ferguson, Mo., said Thursday that they would file a civil lawsuit in Michael Brown’s death.

headline: Michael Brown’s Stepfather Apologizes for Comments
author: Ben Kesling
description: Michael Brown’s stepfather apologized on Wednesday for emotionally-charged comments he made in the minutes after a grand jury announced it wouldn’t bring criminal charges against the officer involved in Mr. Brown’s death.

headline: Grand Jury Decision Sparks Fresh Unrest in Ferguson
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon Tuesday said he would triple the National Guard presence in the St. Louis region in the wake of widespread violence following a grand jury decision not to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of Michael Brown.

headline: Michael Brown’s Family Files Civil Lawsuit Against Ferguson
author: Joe Barrett
description: The family of Michael Brown filed a civil lawsuit against the city of Ferguson, Mo., over the fatal shooting of the unarmed black 18-year-old.

headline: How Ferguson Became a Symbol
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A visual chronology of events in Ferguson, Mo., from the shooting of Michael Brown by Officer Darren Wilson on Aug. 9 to the grand-jury decision on Monday.

headline: Marching Through the Streets
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Demonstrators across the U.S. took to the streets on Tuesday night to protest the decision of a grand jury to not indict Darren Wilson, a white police officer, for shooting unarmed black teenager Michael Brown.

headline: Darren Wilson Says He Feared for His Life
author: Valerie Bauerlein
description: Police officer Darren Wilson says in an interview with ABC he wouldn’t have done anything differently in the August shooting death of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown in the St. Louis suburb of Ferguson.

headline: Protests Spread Across U.S. on Black Friday
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: People demonstrated against the Ferguson, Mo., grand jury decision in the Michael Brown case in cities from San Francisco to New York City.

headline: Comparing the Michael Brown and Eric Garner Cases
author: Yoni Bashan
description: Legal experts compare the cases of  Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., and Eric Garner on Staten Island.

headline: African-Americans Gain Council Seats in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Half of the members of the City Council in Ferguson, Mo., will be African-American following the city’s first election since the shooting death of Michael Brown by a police officer.

headline: St. Louis Mayor Expects Mostly Peaceful Protests
author: Ben Kesling
description: The city’s mayor said he expects mostly nonviolent protests in the days after a grand jury announces whether it will indict the Ferguson police officer who shot and killed Michael Brown, but he also expects police will make arrests.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Deliberations Likely to Begin Soon
author: Ben Kesling
description: The grand jury probing the fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., heard some of its final testimony and is likely to begin deliberations soon, attorneys for Mr. Brown’s family said.

headline: Officer Not Charged in Killing
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown, whose death touched off weeks of civil unrest that made Ferguson, Mo., a national flashpoint over race and justice.

headline: In Ferguson, Art Replaces Arson
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A week after rioters tore through Ferguson, Mo., and other communities protesting a grand jury decision not to indict a police officer who killed 18-year-old Michael Brown in August, street artists tried to recast boarded-up storefronts in the St. Louis suburb with images of peace and racial understanding.

headline: Athletes Say ‘I Can’t Breathe’
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A number of professional athletes have shown their support of protests across the country following grand-jury decisions not to indict police officers in the deaths of Michael Brown and Eric Garner.

headline: Ferguson Residents Help Clean Up, Join in Holiday Celebrations
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Ferguson area residents came out in a show of support Thursday to clean up debris, spruce up buildings and celebrate Thanksgiving after violence erupted in response to a grand jury’s decision in the fatal shooting of Michael Brown.

headline: Brown Family Lawyers Criticize Prosecutor, Legal Process
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Attorneys for Michael Brown’s family lashed out on Tuesday at the local prosecutor and the legal process that led a grand jury not to indict officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of the black teen.

headline: Ferguson-Area School District Cancels Classes Next Week
author: Douglas Belkin
description: A school district adjacent to Ferguson, Mo., has canceled classes next week in anticipation of protests that could follow the grand jury decision in the shooting death of Michael Brown.

headline: Missouri AG Seeks to Block Ferguson Grand Juror From Speaking Out
author: Ben Kesling
description: Missouri’s attorney general filed papers Monday seeking to block a grand juror’s request to speak publicly about the decision not to indict a Ferguson police officer in the shooting death of Michael Brown.

headline: Few Fireworks at Hearing of Attorney General Nominee
author: Andrew Grossman and Devlin Barrett
description: Attorney-general nominee Loretta Lynch vouched for the legality of recent Obama administration decisions on immigration at her relatively tame  confirmation hearing before lawmakers.

headline: Obama Marks a Civil-Rights Turning Point
author: Arian Campo-Flores
description: Fifty years after a civil-rights confrontation at the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Ala., President Barack Obama commemorated the marchers with a soaring speech.

headline: Low-Wage Workers Protest Over Pay
author: Melanie Trottman
description: Low-wage workers from increasingly varied workplaces are staging strikes and protests in 35 states and 190 cities on Thursday, demanding higher minimum wages.

headline: Police Rift Grows for New York Mayor
author: Michael Howard Saul
description: Hundreds of New York City police officers turned their backs as Mayor Bill de Blasio spoke Sunday at a funeral for slain Officer Wenjian Liu, showing the deep divisions between the mayor and the nation’s largest police force.

headline: Ferguson Businesses Vow to Rebuild
author: Pervaiz Shallwani, Ben Kesling and Caroline Porter
description: The St. Louis Regional Chamber estimates about 60 businesses in the Ferguson, Mo., area were looted, vandalized or burned this week after a grand jury declined to indict a white police officer in the shooting of an unarmed black teenager.

headline: Cleveland Officer’s Acquittal in Two Deaths Sets Off Protests
author: Associated Press
description: A white Cleveland officer who fired down on a car at the end of a 137-shot barrage that left the two unarmed black occupants dead was acquitted of criminal charges, setting off angry but mostly orderly protests.

headline: A Sea of Blue Salutes Fallen Police Officer
author: Michael Howard Saul
description: Thousands of police officers from around the country gathered in Queens for the funeral service of Rafael Ramos, one of the two New York City police officers killed in an ambush last weekend.

headline: Missouri Shooting Sparks Protests
author: Ben Kesling and Joe Barrett
description: The police-involved shooting death of an allegedly armed black man in a St. Louis suburb led to small protests and four arrests overnight, according to police.

headline: Autopsy Report Released in Los Angeles Police Shooting
author: Tamara Audi and John R. Emshwiller
description: A highly anticipated autopsy report Monday showed a young, unarmed black man whom Los Angeles police shot and killed in August had fatal gunshot wounds on his back and abdomen.

headline: No Charges for Milwaukee Officer in Fatal Shooting of Black Man
author: Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: A Milwaukee County prosecutor won’t charge a white officer in the April death of a black man, setting the stage for potentially tense protests as the use of deadly force by police remains in the national spotlight.

headline: Gunman Led Life of Trouble Before Attack
author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien, Pervaiz Shallwani and Scott Calvert
description: Investigators piecing together the events leading to the fatal ambush of two police officers in Brooklyn said the alleged killer had a troubled emotional history that included a suicide attempt as recently as a year ago.

headline: Garner Decision Ripples Across City
author: Michael Howard Saul and Jennifer Smith
description: A grand jury’s decision not to indict the officer at the center of the Eric Garner chokehold case sparks demonstrations and emotional reactions across New York City.

headline: Protesters Rally in Washington, Other Cities
author: Rebecca Ballhaus and Leslie Brody
description: Thousands marched in Washington and several other U.S. cities to protest a series of grand jury decisions not to indict white police officers who killed unarmed black men.

headline: Peter Sellars on Art, Politics and Controversy
author: Alexandra Wolfe
description: Experimental director Peter Sellars uses theater, dance and opera to push boundaries and pose painful questions about race and inequality.

headline: NYC Police Officer Shot Saturday in Critical Condition
author: JOE JACKSON and ADAM JANOS
description: An undercover New York City police officer who was shot early Saturday evening in Queens remains in critical but stable condition at Jamaica Hospital.

headline: The 10-Point: Gerard Baker on Ferguson Violence, Activist Investors, Chuck Hagel’s Year and More
author: Gerard Baker
description: A personal, guided tour to the best scoops and stories every day in The Wall Street Journal, from Editor in Chief Gerard Baker.

headline: The 10-Point: Gerard Baker on Drone Strategy, Comcast, Nasdaq’s Highs and More
author: Gerard Baker
description: A personal, guided tour to the best scoops and stories every day in The Wall Street Journal, from Editor in Chief Gerard Baker.

headline: The 10-Point: Gerard Baker on Ferguson Unrest, Chuck Hagel’s Departure, Nuclear Negotiations and More
author: Gerard Baker
description: A personal, guided tour to the best scoops and stories every day in The Wall Street Journal, from Editor in Chief Gerard Baker.

headline: Events That Shaped a Turbulent 2014
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: From the rise of Islamic State to the Republicans’ sweep of the midterm elections, the past year brought a number of game-changing news developments. Among them were the Ebola outbreak, the police shooting in Ferguson, Mo., the Ukraine crisis and the drop in oil prices.

headline: Obama’s Muted Ferguson Response Reflects Limited Options
author: Colleen McCain Nelsonand Byron Tau
description: The president’s response to the rioting in Ferguson underscores both the role he has carved for himself as uniquely well-suited to bridge the nation’s racial divide and his discomfort at times with embracing the role.

headline: Some New York City Police Set to Wear Body Cameras
author: Mara Gay
description: On Friday, 27 of 54 officers in a pilot program were scheduled to begin using the lapel-attached cameras on the job. Citywide calls for police body cameras intensified following Eric Garner’s death last summer.

headline: Two Officers Shot Amid Ferguson Protest
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Two police officers were shot early Thursday outside the Ferguson, Mo., police department as demonstrators gathered after the police chief resigned in the wake of a scathing Justice Department report alleging bias in the department.

headline: Cameras Put New Pressure on Police
author: Zusha Elinson
description: Police body cameras have gained considerable currency in the wake of the fatal shooting of an unarmed black 18-year-old in Ferguson, Mo., this summer. But what happens if officers don’t turn their cameras on?

headline: LeBron James, Kyrie Irving Wear ‘I Can’t Breathe’ Shirts
author: Alex Raskin
description: LeBron James and Kyrie Irving were among NBA players who warmed up before Monday’s Nets-Cavaliers game wearing T-shirts reading ‘I Can’t Breathe,’ referencing the death of Eric Garner.

headline: Judge Issues Temporary Order on Use of Tear Gas in Ferguson Protests
author: Joe Barrett and Ben Kesling
description: A federal judge in St. Louis issued a temporary restraining order Thursday against the use of tear gas and other agents to disperse peaceful demonstrators without providing adequate warning and meeting other conditions.

headline: Los Angeles Police to Wear Body Cameras
author: Miriam Jordan
description: Mayor Eric Garcetti announced Tuesday the rollout of on-body cameras for the city’s entire police force, an endorsement of a tool that has gained attention since a white police officer fatally shot an unarmed black man in Ferguson, Mo., in the summer.

headline: Tensions Simmer After Shooting Decision
author:
Pervaiz Shallwani,
		
	Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: A cold rain fell amid relative calm in Ferguson, Mo., on Wednesday evening, following a day of clean-up after riots in the wake of a grand jury’s decision not to indict a white police officer in the killing of a black teenager.

headline: ‘Die-Ins’ of Police Protests Hark Back to Great Depression
author: Ben Zimmer
description: The “die-ins” of the protests against the Eric Garner and Michael Brown killings by police hark back to a strike in the Great Depression.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Reconvening Monday
author: Ben Kesling
description: The grand jury deciding whether to indict a police officer in the shooting death of teenager Michael Brown will reconvene Monday, according to a county official.

headline: Ferguson Police Officer Not Charged in Black Teen’s Shooting
author: Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: A grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown, sparking renewed unrest in Ferguson Mo., which became a national flash point over race and justice during weeks of turmoil this summer.

headline: Portraits of New York City Protesters
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Recent protesters in New York City range from veteran activists to first timers. They have demonstrated against the Eric Garner and Michael Brown grand jury decisions.

headline: Ferguson Uneasy After Violent Night
author: Ben Kesling, Pervaiz Shallwani and Mark Peters
description: More protests were planned throughout the region after a grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown.

headline: Missouri Declares State of Emergency
author: Ben Kesling
description: Gov. Jay Nixon declared a state of emergency for Missouri, ahead of an anticipated announcement from a grand jury in the shooting death of Michael Brown and protests expected to take place in the St. Louis area.

headline: Protesters Swarm Mall Near Ferguson
author: Matthew Dolan and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Several hundred protesters swarmed a mall near Ferguson, Mo., in a Black Friday protest over the lack of an indictment in the police-involved fatal shooting of 18-year-old Michael Brown.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Decision Expected at 8 p.m. Central
author: Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: St. Louis County Prosecutor Robert McCulloch will announce at 8 p.m. Central Standard Time a grand jury’s decision on whether to indict white Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown.

headline: In Ferguson, a Long Road Getting Back to Business
author:
Ruth Simon,
		
	Ben Kesling
		
	and Leslie Josephs
description: Ten months after Michael Brown’s shooting death, the community is struggling to recover and rebound.

headline: National Guard Pares Presence in Ferguson Area
author: Ben Kesling
description: The Missouri National Guard has already begun to reduce its footprint in the St. Louis region, though troops remain in Ferguson, according to state officials.

headline: Proceedings: Highlights from the Law Blog
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: The U.S. Supreme Court raised eyebrows when it demanded that Foley & Lardner LLP patent attorney Howard Shipley show cause as to “why he should not be sanctioned.”

headline: Nitro Signs Up $15M From Battery Ventures for Digital Documents
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Nitro Software Inc., a digital document company that moved from Australia to San Francisco two years ago, said it raised $15 million in new financing from Battery Ventures.

headline: Ferguson Braces for Grand Jury Decision
author: Ben Kesling
description: Workers are boarding up windows in Ferguson, Mo., and police are re-stocking tear gas as they prepare for civil unrest that could follow a grand jury decision on whether to indict a police officer in the shooting death of an unarmed 18-year-old.

headline: Protesters Turn Out in U.S. Cities Following Decision
author: Thomas MacMillan, Alejandro Lazo and Cameron McWhirter
description: Protests broke out in a number of U.S. cities following the decision on Monday by a grand jury not to indict a Ferguson, Mo., police officer in the shooting death of a black teenager.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Still in Session
author: Ben Kesling
description: The grand jury deciding whether to indict officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of Michael Brown is still in session, according to the county prosecutor.

headline: Ferguson Business Owners Survey the Damage
author: Ben Kesling And Pervaiz Shallwani
description: After a night of tear gas from police and rocks thrown by vandals, shop owners in Ferguson, Mo., were out with brooms and dustpans, cleaning up and preparing for another possible night of protests.

headline: Protests Spread in U.S. Cities Following Decision
author: Thomas MacMillan, Alejandro Lazo and Cameron McWhirter
description: Protests broke out in a number of U.S. cities following the decision on Monday by a grand jury not to indict a Ferguson, Mo., police officer in the shooting death of a black teenager.

headline: Protests Ramp Up Over Police Killings
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Thousands of protesters, including family members of Eric Garner and Michael Brown,  marched in Washington, D.C., New York and other cities on Saturday to call attention to the recent deaths of unarmed black men at the hands of police and to call for legislative action.

headline: Faces, and Forces, Behind New York City Protests
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: The thousands in New York who have protested the recent grand jury decisions not to indict white police officers in the deaths of unarmed black men cut a wide swath.

headline: Ferguson Hit by Looting, Arson
author: Ben Kesling, Pervaiz Shallwani and Mark Peters
description: Peaceful protests in Ferguson, Mo., gave way to looting and arson in the wake of a grand jury decision not to indict a white police officer in the summer shooting of an unarmed black teenager.

headline: Protest Turns Violent in Berkeley
author: Jim Carlton
description: A protest in Berkeley, Calif., following the grand jury decision in New York not to indict the police officer involved in the death of Eric Garner turned violent Saturday night as police say some protesters smashed windows and vandalized cars.

headline: Protesters Halt BART Train Service
author: Alejandro Lazo
description: Protesters in Oakland, Calif., wearing T-shirts reading “black lives matter” shut down train service on the Bay Area Rapid Transit system between San Francisco and the East Bay for more than an hour Friday morning.

headline: Officials Gird for More Unrest in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon said law-enforcement officials have been working to make sure residents will be kept safe once prosecutors announce whether a suburban St. Louis police officer will face charges for fatally shooting 18-year-old Michael Brown.

headline: Protesters Hit Streets Again, Defying Mayor
author: Adam Janos
description: Hundreds of protesters took to Manhattan’s streets Tuesday evening to rally against what they say is unfair treatment by the New York Police Department, in defiance of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s call for a halt to demonstrations until two slain police officers are laid to rest.

headline: Protests Against Police Shootings Continue in California
author: Zusha Elinson
description: Protests against police shootings continued for a fourth night in San Francisco’s East Bay area, as hundreds marched through Berkeley and Oakland, blocking a highway and prompting the cancelation of a city council meeting.

headline: U.S. Won’t Charge Ferguson Police Officer Darren Wilson
author: Devlin Barrett
description: The Justice Department said it would not file federal civil-rights charges against the former Ferguson, Mo., police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black teen last year.

headline: Grand Jury Transcripts Show Widely Varying Witness Testimony
author: A Wall Street Journal Roundup
description: The transcripts of the grand jury proceedings investigating police officer Darren Wilson’s actions in the shooting death of Michael Brown reveal that witnesses’ testimony varied widely on the key details of the Aug. 9 encounter.

headline: Holder Seeks to Fill Gaps in Police Data
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Attorney General Eric Holder said Thursday the country should do more to track when police officers kill and when they are killed.

headline: Ferguson Council Candidates Vow Change
author: Ben Kesling
description: About a mile from the site of seemingly endless clashes between police and protesters in Ferguson, Mo., a slate of candidates for City Council talk frankly about how to mend their community.

headline: The 10-Point: Gerard Baker on the NYPD Killings, New Saudi Oil Strategy, UPS’s Big Test and More
author: Gerard Baker
description: A personal, guided tour to the best scoops and stories every day in The Wall Street Journal, from Editor in Chief Gerard Baker.

headline: Police Probe ‘Ambush’ of Officers in Ferguson
author: Mark Peters  and Ben Kesling
description: Police are investigating the shooting of two officers involved in crowd control at a protest in Ferguson, Mo., early Thursday, in what St. Louis County Police Chief Jon Belmar described as an “ambush.”

headline: Police Move to Revamp Tactics
author: Pervaiz Shallwani,  Zusha Elinson and Gary Fields
description: Police departments around the country are racing to develop new training rules on the use of force, a response that has gained urgency amid scrutiny from the U.S. Justice Department.

headline: Obama Faces Limits in Overseeing Police
author: Devlin Barrett and Colleen McCain Nelson
description: The deaths of unarmed African-American men in Ferguson, Mo., and New York City at the hands of white officers have sparked a debate over deadly force while highlighting federal limits in dealing with local police.

headline: New York City Police Officer Accidentally Shoots, Kills Unarmed Man
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Police say the officer killed a 28-year-old unarmed man in the stairwell of a Brooklyn housing project, a death Mayor Bill de Blasio called a “tragic mistake.”

headline: NYC Mayor, Police Unions Postpone Debate
author: Michael Howard Saul and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio and police unions agreed to end a war of words until two officers fatally shot this weekend are laid to rest, as law-enforcement agencies nationwide assessed the safety of members.

headline: Protests Spread Across U.S.
author: Laura Meckler  and Thomas MacMillan
description: Another round of protests erupted Friday in several major cities as demonstrators blocked traffic and staged die-ins after this week’s New York grand jury decision not to indict a white officer in the choke-hold death of an unarmed black man.

headline: Sizing Up a Prosecutor’s Performance
author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien
description: Elected officials, legal experts and police officers on Thursday differed on Staten Island District Attorney Dan Donovan’s handling of the grand jury that declined to indict the officer involved in Eric Garner’s death.

headline: Chokehold Ruling Sparks Protests in New York
author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien, Michael Howard Saul and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Protests erupted around New York City after a grand jury declined to indict a police officer in the death of an unarmed African-American. The ruling also sparked a federal investigation.

headline: Violence Erupts in Baltimore After Freddie Gray Funeral
author: Scott Calvert and Kris Maher
description: Riots, looting and violent unrest engulfed swaths of Baltimore after the funeral for Freddie Gray, a black man who died in police custody.

headline: Protests Spread Across Country
author: Adam Janos And Thomas MacMillan
description: Protests rippled across the country Thursday for a second day after a grand jury declined to indict a New York City police officer in the July death of Eric Garner, a black man who was placed in an apparent chokehold.

headline: Protests Spread Across Country
author: Adam Janos and Thomas MacMillan
description: Protests rippled across the country Thursday, a day after a grand jury declined to indict a New York City police officer in the July death of Eric Garner, a black man who was placed in an apparent chokehold.

headline: Hundreds of Police Killings Are Uncounted
author: Rob Barry and Coulter Jones
description: More than 550 justifiable homicides by police between 2007 and 2012 aren’t included in records kept by the FBI.

headline: Obama Condemns Violence in Baltimore
author: Carol E. Lee And Devlin Barrett
description: The president called on the nation to do some “soul-searching” in the wake of the violence that erupted in Baltimore, while asserting there are limits on what he, or any president, can do to change the system.

headline: Killings of New York Police Officers Spark Backlash to Protests
author: Heather Haddon
description: The assassination of two New York City police officers has emboldened police and their supporters to lash out at weeks of nationwide protest and criticism that they say have left police more vulnerable.

headline: Putting Police Back on the Beat
author: Gary Fields and John R. Emshwiller
description: As deadly police encounters prompt a re-examination of tactics used by law-enforcement agencies, New Haven, Conn., shows why community policing is attracting a fresh surge of attention.

headline: Seattle Police Chafe Under New Orders
author: John R. Emshwiller and Gary Fields
description: The city reins in prosecution for minor crimes and lets police direct some offenders toward social services rather than the criminal justice system.

headline: South Carolina Shooting Bolsters Calls for Police Cameras
author: Cameron McWhirter and Zusha Elinson
description: A bystander’s video showing a white South Carolina policeman fatally shooting an unarmed black man as he fled has bolstered nationwide calls to require all police officers to wear body cameras.

headline: Ferguson Legal Fight Extends Beyond Grand Jury
author: Ashby Jones And Devlin Barrett
description: A grand jury’s decision to reject charges against a white officer in the shooting death of a black teenager in Missouri likely won’t be the last word from the courts on the tragic events of Aug. 9.

headline: No Decision on Ferguson Officer if He Isn’t Indicted
author: Ben Kesling
description: Senior officials in Ferguson, Mo., said the town hasn’t decided whether Officer Darren Wilson will return to the police force if a grand jury doesn’t indict him in the shooting death of an unarmed local teenager.

headline: Protests Pass Quietly in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Investigations continued Friday in the shooting of two police officers after protests lasted only a few hours the night before as rain, activist organization and police tactics defused tensions.

headline: Ferguson Vote Result Seen as Hopeful Sign
author: Ben Kesling
description: A high voter turnout and a shift in the racial makeup of the City Council during a closely watched local election this week signaled hopes for change after a summer of unrest in Ferguson, Mo., officials and residents said.

headline: Police Deny Bullying Suspect in Officers’ Shooting in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: St. Louis County police rejected allegations that a man who allegedly shot two police officers in Ferguson, Mo., last week was beaten by police officers and coerced into admitting guilt.

headline: Cardinal Dolan Urges Support for NYPD
author: Erica Orden
description: New York Cardinal Timothy Dolan addressed the fatal shootings of two police officers, urging support for the police department as well as for Police Commissioner William Bratton and Mayor Bill de Blasio.

headline: Police Chief Defends Shooting of Armed Teen in Berkeley, Mo.
author: Ben Kesling
description: Multiple witnesses said they saw a black teenager pull a gun on a Berkeley, Mo., police officer just before the officer fatally shot the youth last week, said the city’s police chief.

headline: Cleveland Police Say Video Exists of Police Shooting
author: Mark Peters
description: Cleveland officials have video of a police shooting that killed a 12-year-old boy over the weekend, saying the visual evidence provides a clear accounting of what happened.

headline: U.S. Military Gear Keeps Flowing to Missouri
author: Julian E. Barnes
description: The Defense Department has continued to send surplus military gear to police departments in Missouri in the wake of the shooting death of an unarmed black teenager, despite criticism of the equipment-supply program.

headline: Ferguson Beefs Up Response After Violence
author: Ben Kesling, Pervaiz Shallwani and Mark Peters
description: Missouri’s governor said he would triple the National Guard presence in the St. Louis region after widespread violence following a grand-jury decision not to indict a police officer in the shooting death of an unarmed teen.

headline: NYPD Shooting Suspect Referenced Garner, Brown Cases
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Two New York City police officers were shot and killed in their patrol car outside a Brooklyn housing project on Saturday. Police are investigating social-media posts in which the suspected gunman foreshadowed the killings.

headline: U.S. Finds Racial Bias in Ferguson Police, Courts
author: Andrew Grossman
description: Police in Ferguson, Mo., routinely violated the civil rights of the city’s black residents, a Justice Department probe has concluded. The city’s courts were also cited for racial bias.

headline: No Slowdown on NYPD Enforcement, Union Says
author: Michael Howard Saul
description: New York City’s main police union hasn’t initiated or supported a deliberate slowdown, the union’s president said, a day after records were released showing a steep reduction in arrests and summonses for a second week in a row.

headline: Top Judge Urges Grand-Jury Changes
author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien
description: New York’s top judge on Tuesday proposed legislation to make grand-jury proceedings more open to the public and have judges preside over deliberations for police-involved homicides and serious assaults.

headline: Attorney General Nominee Takes the Stage
author: Andrew Grossman and Devlin Barrett
description: Loretta Lynch will step into the Senate spotlight on Wednesday as the Justice Department she has been nominated to lead considers a series of hot-button issues ranging from possible civil-rights violations by police to government leaks.

headline: Justice Department Report to Criticize Treatment of Minorities by Ferguson Police
author: Devlin Barrett And Ben Kesling
description: The Justice Department is preparing to issue reports on the Ferguson, Mo., police department explaining its expected decision not to file criminal charges against a former officer who killed an unarmed black teen while excoriating the department’s treatment of minorities.

headline: J.W. Childs Buys Winery From TPG Growth-Backed Vincraft
author: Lillian Rizzo
description: The Waltham, Mass., firm has acquired Kosta Browne Winery, a Santa Rosa, Calif.-based winery, from TPG Growth-backed Vincraft Group, according to a news release.

headline: Officials Lay Out Rules for Police Handling of Ferguson Protests
author: Ben Kesling
description: “Rules of conduct” released as grand jury appeared close to announcing whether to indict a white police officer for the killing of an unarmed black teenager this summer.

headline: Maker of Police Body Cameras Is Acquired
author: Tarun Shukla
description: Vievu, a maker of police body cameras, has been acquired by Safariland, which is bulking up its portfolio of security products ahead of a planned initial public offering next year

headline: Police Chasing ‘Scores’ of Leads in Ferguson Shooting of Two Officers
author: Ben Kesling
description: Law enforcement has been chasing ’scores’ of leads but has made no arrests in the shooting of two Ferguson, Mo., police officers early Thursday morning, according to local police.

headline: Ferguson Set for Elections
author: Ben Kesling
description: Half of the St. Louis suburb’s council seats are up for grabs after the fatal police shooting last August.

headline: Brooklyn District Attorney to Impanel Grand Jury in Akai Gurley Case
author: BySonja Sharp, Rebecca Davis O’Brien and Melanie Grayce West
description: The Brooklyn District Attorney Ken Thompson said he plans to impanel a grand jury to consider the Nov. 20 shooting death of Akai Gurley at the hands of a rookie New York City police officer

headline: Poll Shows Majority of Blacks View King’s Dream as Unrealized
author: Ben Kesling
description: White and black Americans disagree about equality, opportunity and racism in the U.S., more than 46 years after the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr., according to a Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll.

headline: Officer in Ferguson Shooting Resigns
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Darren Wilson, the white Ferguson police officer who shot to death a black teen last summer and avoided criminal prosecution this week has resigned from the police force.

headline: NYPD Chief Seeks to Tame Protest Tensions
author: Jonathan House And Reid J. Epstein
description: New York City Police Commissioner William Bratton said his department would seek to meet with police union leaders and engage in other talks to calm racial tensions flamed by recent high-profile killings.

headline: Ferguson Area Clergy Lead Peaceful Protest
author: Ben Kesling
description: A sunrise prayer vigil and dozens of clergy marching in the streets here Tuesday was a stark counterpoint to the destruction and looting that took place Monday night just miles away in Ferguson.

headline: FBI Director Discusses Hard Truths on Policing, Race Relations
author: Devlin Barrett
description: The U.S. is at a crossroads on matters of race relations and law enforcement, presenting “hard truths” that its citizens and police must confront, FBI Director James Comey.

headline: Funeral Held for Man Fatally Shot by New York Police Officer
author: Keiko Morris
description: Akai Gurley, a 28-year-old New York City man who was fatally shot by a police officer, was remembered Saturday by family and friends as a caring father, son and big brother.

headline: Ferguson Report Unlikely to Help Many in Civil Suits
author: Ben Kesling
description: A Justice Department report highlighting rampant bias in the Ferguson, Mo., police department and court system is likely to bring sweeping change to the city but may not help many of those affected sue for damages.

headline: Mayor and Police Unions Meet; No Resolution, Unions Say
author: Michael Howard Saul and Joe Jackson
description: A two-hour meeting focuses on safety; “actions speak louder than words and time will tell,” union says.

headline: South Carolina Shooting Bolsters Calls for Police Cameras
author: Cameron McWhirter and Zusha Elinson
description: A bystander’s video showing a white South Carolina policeman fatally shooting an unarmed black man as he fled has bolstered nationwide calls to require all police officers to wear body cameras.

headline: Ferguson Legal Fight Extends Beyond Grand Jury
author: Ashby Jones And Devlin Barrett
description: A grand jury’s decision to reject charges against a white officer in the shooting death of a black teenager in Missouri likely won’t be the last word from the courts on the tragic events of Aug. 9.

headline: No Decision on Ferguson Officer if He Isn’t Indicted
author: Ben Kesling
description: Senior officials in Ferguson, Mo., said the town hasn’t decided whether Officer Darren Wilson will return to the police force if a grand jury doesn’t indict him in the shooting death of an unarmed local teenager.

headline: Justice Department Recommends Changes to Philadelphia Police Policies
author: Scott Calvert
description: A Justice Department review of police-involved shootings in Philadelphia recommended dozens of changes, after finding serious shortcomings with policies and training.

headline: Senate Clears Law-Enforcement Death-Reporting Legislation
author: Rob Barry
description: The Senate cleared and sent to President Obama legislation that would provide strong incentives for states and federal law-enforcement agencies to report deaths in custody and during arrests.

headline: Police Investigations into Deaths Scrutinized
author: Zusha Elinson
description: Lawmakers in some states are moving to make investigations of police-involved killings more independent by requiring outside review or special prosecutors in such cases.

headline: Holder Seeks to Fill Gaps in Police Data
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Attorney General Eric Holder said Thursday the country should do more to track when police officers kill and when they are killed.

headline: One Ferguson Police Employee Fired, Two Under Review for Racist Emails
author: Ben Kesling
description: The mayor of Ferguson, Mo., said Wednesday a police department employee had been fired and two others remain under investigation for sending racist emails.

headline: Law and Evidence Tilted in Ferguson Police’s Favor
author: Ashby Jones And Joe Palazzolo
description: The factors that ultimately shaped the grand jury’s decision were in place at an early stage.

headline: Ahead of Ferguson Decision, Attorney General Urges Calm, Restraint
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Attorney General Eric Holder is urging police to minimize confrontation and protesters to be peaceful ahead of a grand jury decision on whether to indict the police officer who shot an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Mo.

headline: Police Stories Hit Home for Jets’ Richardson
author: Alex Raskin
description: ‘Someone got murdered,’ said Jets defensive end Sheldon Richardson, a St. Louis native, about the grand-jury decision in the death of Staten Island resident Eric Garner. ‘It’s just that simple.’

headline: Officer Liu’s Funeral Set for Sunday
author: Mike Vilensky and Mark Morales
description: The funeral for New York City police Officer Wenjian Liu, one of two officers fatally shot in their squad car in Brooklyn, has been set for Sunday.

headline: Obama Calls for Peaceful Protests
author: Colleen McCain Nelson and Byron Tau
description: Barack Obama called for peaceful protests and a restrained response from law enforcement on after a grand jury declined to indict a police officer in the shooting death of an unarmed 18-year-old in Ferguson, Mo.

headline: Missouri Running Out of Emergency Funds for Ferguson
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Gov. Jay Nixon said he would call a special session of the state legislature to provide “critical” funding for the National Guard and Highway Patrol still on patrol in Ferguson.

headline: Police Shooting of Unarmed 19-Year-Old Prompts Protest
author: Associated Press
description: The fatal shooting of an unarmed black 19-year-old by a white police officer, who authorities say fired after he was assaulted, prompted protesters to take to the streets with chants of “Black Lives Matter.”

headline: Prosecutors Make First Arson Arrest From Ferguson Unrest
author: Ben Kesling
description: Federal agents made the first arrest for arson charges related to unrest in Ferguson, Mo. Local and federal officials have been working on multiple investigations in the aftermath of the Ferguson protests.

headline: Federal Review Faults Police Response to Ferguson Protests
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Local police improperly used military tactics—including dogs, tear gas and snipers—that escalated rather than eased protests in Ferguson, Mo., last year, according to a soon-to-be-released Justice Department report.

headline: Ferguson Protests Leave Three Shot, Five Arrested
author: Associated Press
description: Looting, fires and gunfire broke out in Ferguson overnight during protests in response to the death of a black man in police custody in Baltimore.

headline: Man Faces 5 Felony Charges in Ferguson Police Shooting
author: Ben Kesling
description: A 20-year-old man who allegedly shot two police officers at a late-night protest in Ferguson, Mo., last week, appeared in court to face five felony charges, including three class-A felonies.

headline: Obama to Ask Congress for Funding for Federal Response to Ferguson
author: Michael R. Crittenden  And Kristina Peterson
description: President Barack Obama is expected to ask lawmakers to add money for body cameras and other community policing initiatives to a broader spending bill as part of his response to Ferguson unrest.

headline: Ferguson Protesters Aim for Bigger Movement
author: Dan Frosch, Ana Campoy  and Valerie Bauerlein
description: Many of the young people who have taken to the streets around the U.S. in Ferguson-related protests vow to turn the rallies against police brutality into a movement that will last long beyond this week.

headline: Violence Flares at Berkeley Protests
author: Alejandro Lazo And Jim Carlton
description: A protest turned violent for a second straight night Sunday, resulting in at least eight arrests and an untold amount of damage to vandalized downtown businesses.

headline: Ferguson Officer Won’t Get Severance
author: Matthew Dolan
description: The Ferguson, Mo., police officer who killed an unarmed black 18-year-old after a violent encounter this summer and resigned from the force Saturday left the city voluntarily and won’t receive severance, officials said.

headline: Protesters Aim at Macy’s on Black Friday
author: Mike Vilensky and Pia Catton
description: Demonstrators massed inside and outside Macy’s on Herald Square on Black Friday in a bid to flex economic power after a Missouri grand jury’s decision not to indict a police officer in the fatal shooting of a black teenager.

headline: Obama on Ferguson: ‘No Excuse’ for Violence
author: Byron Tau
description: President Barack Obama said there was “no excuse” for vandalism and violence, speaking a day after the Ferguson, Mo., grand jury decision was announced and resulted in unrest.

headline: Man Charged in Ferguson Police Shootings
author: Joe Barrett
description: A 20-year-old man was charged in the shootings of two police officers providing security during a protest in Ferguson, Mo., last week.

headline: Missouri Judge to Take Over Ferguson Cases
author: Ben Kesling
description: The Missouri Supreme Court on Monday reassigned all municipal court cases in Ferguson to a state appeals court judge, essentially taking over the city’s court system.

headline: Ferguson Protests Continue Across the U.S.
author: A Wall Street Journal Roundup
description: Protests resumed across the nation Tuesday, marking the second night of demonstrations following the decision by a grand jury not to indict a Ferguson, Mo., police officer in the shooting death of a black teenager.

headline: Officer in Ferguson Shooting Resigns
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Darren Wilson, the white Ferguson police officer who shot to death a black teen last summer and avoided criminal prosecution this week has resigned from the police force.

headline: Ex-Officer Indicted for Murder in South Carolina Shooting of Black Man
author: Associated Press
description: A white former North Charleston police officer has been indicted on a murder charge in the fatal shooting of an unarmed black man who was running away from the officer.
